statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Utah 68, Adams State 52
article.story: SALT LAKE CITY (AP) -- Bryant Markson scored 12 points to lead Utah to a 68-52 victory Monday night over Division II Adams State. The Utes (6-3) led the entire game, and were never seriously challenged by the Grizzlies (5-4). Shaun Green scored 11 points for the Utes, making 3-of-4 from the 3-point line. Luke Nevill added 12 points and four rebounds. Wes Jensen led the Grizzlies, scoring 17 points and shooting 5-of-13 from the 3-point line. Richard Mincy scored 15 points on 7-of-8 from the field. With 11:41 left in the second half, Jensen hit a 3-pointer to narrow Utah's lead to 41-33. Utah responded with a 14-4 run that left the Utes up 55-37. Adams State rallied from a 14-point halftime deficit with back-to-back 3-pointers to open the second half. After Utah made a free throw, the Grizzlies closed the gap to seven points on a basked by Mincy with 18:15 left. That was the closest they came the rest of the way. Utah shot 50 percent compared to Adams State's 39 percent on 20-of-51. Adams State attempted 28 3-pointers in the game and made nine, compared to Utah's five 3-pointers on 12 attempts.
